meanings.definition: Feeling or showing sudden, uncontrollable fear or anxiety.
meanings.sent1: She felt panicky when she realized she was lost in the unfamiliar woods.
meanings.sent2: The panicky expression on his face revealed his deep fear of heights.
meanings.sent3: The panicky squirrel ran in circles trying to escape from the playful dog.
meanings.sent4: The panicky students rushed to finish their exams before the bell rang.
meanings.sent5: The panicky sound of the alarm made everyone evacuate the building quickly.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or resulting from panic.
meanings.sent1: The panicky crowd pushed and shoved to get out of the crowded stadium.
meanings.sent2: Her panicky behavior only made the situation more chaotic.
meanings.sent3: The panicky driver honked loudly at the slow-moving traffic ahead.
meanings.sent4: The panicky response to the fire alarm caused unnecessary chaos in the office.
meanings.sent5: The panicky voice on the phone conveyed the urgency of the situation.

meanings.sent1: The panicky cat darted under the bed at the sound of thunder.
meanings.sent2: He looked around panicky, searching for his lost wallet.
meanings.sent3: The panicky chef accidentally dropped the entire tray of desserts.
meanings.sent4: The panicky passengers clutched their seats as the turbulence shook the plane.
meanings.sent5: The panicky expression on her face mirrored the urgency of the situation.
